string.value: The entry specified in this field is shown in the browser window title bar. The field is used by search engines and sitemaps
Use this field for at short description of the page
The page type selection influences the behavior and features of your page, like 'a normal page' or 'a blog'. The options available depend on features installed.
Select where in the content tree you want the page to be placed.
The entry specified in this field is shown in the browser address bar. The field is used by search engines
The entry specified in this field can be used in the navigation on the website
The specified title is too long. Make it shorter and try again
The specified menu title is too long. Make it shorter and try again
Send the page to another status
The entry specified in this field is shown in the browser window title bar. The field is used by search engines and sitemaps
The entry specified in this field can be used in the navigation on the website
According to the current URL replacement rules, URL title was changed to '{0}'
The entry specified in this field is shown in the browser address bar as a part of the URL address. The field is used by search engines

The entry specified in this field is a shorter version of the actual page URL and redirects to it, when entered in the browser address bar. Note that some servers may have to be configured to support this feature.
Use this field for a short description of the page
The page type selection defines the role of the page, like 'a normal page' or 'a blog'. The options available depend on features installed.
All subpages will also be deleted. Continue?
Another page is using the specified URL title. URL titles must be unique among pages with the same parent.

The specified URL title contains invalid characters. Since this field is used to build the web address for the page, certain special characters (like question mark, slash and dot) are not allowed. You can use letters, digits and dash.
The specified URL title is too long. Make it shorter and try again
Another page is using the specified Friendly URL. Friendly URL's must be unique.
The title can not be empty.
The page did not validate and has not been saved. Please examine field messages.
Get an overview of pages and other content that haven't been published yet.
The list below displays pages and other content which are currently in draft or are ready to be approved / published.
Delete Translation for the selected page
Add new page below the selected
You should create a 'Page Template' first. Go to the 'Layout' perspective and create one.
To add a page, you should firstly add at least one language. It can be done in the 'System' perspective.
You should create a 'Page Type' first. Go to the 'Layout' perspective and create one.
To create a homepage, a page type without the "only subpages" restriction is required, but none have been added yet. You can add one under the Layout perspective.
To create a subpage, a page type without the the only homepages restriction is required, but none have been added yet. You can add one under the Layout perspective.
The rules that define availability for Page Types prohibit adding a page here.
Add host name association to page

You can associate a host name (or a domain name) to a page by specifying it in the field below. Please note that the DNS settings for the specified host name must also be configured, which is done outside this system.
Specify the host name (like 'www.composite.net' or 'composite.net') you want to associate with this page
The syntax of the host name is not valid
This host name is already associated to a page. You must remove the existing association first.
Remove host name association from page
The host names you select will no longer be associated with the page
Please confirm deletion of all sub pages
The page is referenced by another type that does not allow cascade deletes. This operation is halted
This page has one or more page folders or metadata fields defined on it. Delete these first.
Date and time the page has been scheduled to publish automatically. To edit, see the Publication Schedule in Edit Page mode.
Date and time the page has been scheduled to unpublish automatically. To edit, see the Publication Schedule in Edit Page mode.
You are about to publish these pages. Continue?
